description: At the European Hospital in Rafah, there are shortages of pain medication, antibiotics, even  bandages, American volunteers say they are unable to save lives — and unable to evacuate to safety.
title: Trapped in Rafah, U.S. medical volunteers say they can't save lives and can't evacuate

description: French Gates says she is "immensely proud" of the work of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, and the decision to step down as co-chair was not easy. Her last day is June 7.
title: Melinda French Gates resigns as co-chair from the Gates Foundation

description: Girl Scouts Troop 6,000 in New York City helps migrant girls establish connections and a platform to start a new life in a new country but also equips them with crucial life skills.
title: A Girl Scouts troop offers hope and 'sisters for life' for migrant children

description: More than 50,000 people took to the streets of the capital city Tbilisi over the weekend to protest against proposed legislation that critics say is modeled on a Russian law used to crush dissent.
title: Why protesters in Georgia are opposed to a 'foreign agents' law and why it matters

description: Russia launched a surprise new offensive in northeast Ukraine, near the second largest city of Kharkiv. Russian troops are continuing to advance, we get the latest from our Ukraine correspondent. And in another development in that war, Russia's President Putin replaced the country's defense minister. We get context on both events from a retired U.S. Lieutenant Colonel who used to oversee European affairs at the National Security council.
title: Russia Makes Surprising Gains in Ukraine

description: Clinical trials of MDMA have been promising, but concerns have emerged about the quality of the research. A June hearing scheduled by the Food and Drug Administration is likely to address them.
title: As the FDA evaluates ecstasy treatment for PTSD, questions mount about the evidence

description: Even if Israel and Gaza agree to a cease-fire, unexploded ordnance could continue to kill and maim Palestinians in Gaza for years. A Haitian gang leader says he's ready for a long fight.
title: A hidden danger in Gaza; a Haitian gang leader speaks up

description: Barbecue is the man who convinced many of Haiti's gangs to stop fighting each other and start fighting the government. He spoke to NPR about his latest plans.
title: Haiti's notorious gang leader, Barbecue, says his forces are ready for a long fight

description: Nature's healing power is an immensely personal focus for Foster. He made his film after being burned out from long, grinding hours at work. After the release of the film, he suffered from insomnia.
title: My Octopus Teacher's Craig Foster dives into the ocean again in 'Amphibious Soul'

description: A new type of traveler is part of the post-pandemic reset at U.S. hotels, along with fewer daily cleanings and pancake-slinging machines.
title: With 'bleisure' and fewer workers, the American hotel is in recovery

description: The United Nations says 7,500 metric tons of unexploded ordnance litter the Gaza Strip. The U.N. says it could take 14 years to dispose of these dangers.
title: In Gaza, a hidden threat could kill Palestinians even after a cease-fire

description: Sen. Robert Menendez, a powerful Democrat from New Jersey, goes on trial in Manhattan on federal corruption charges. Two New Jersey businessmen accused of bribing him are his co-defendants.
title: Democratic Sen. Bob Menendez goes on trial in New York on federal corruption charges

description: At Bear Divide, just outside Los Angeles, you can see a rare spectacle of nature. This is one of the only places in the western United States where you can see bird migration during daylight hours.
title: On this unassuming trail near LA, bird watchers see something spectacular

description: During the Rwandan genocide in 1994, Josephine Dusabimana smuggled ethnic Tutsis out of the country as neighbors attacked neighbors and almost a million people died.
title: As a brutal genocide raged around her, Josephine smuggled 12 people to safety

description: There's a good chance your zone shifted when the USDA updated its plant hardiness map in 2023. Zoom in on what that means for your garden.
title: The USDA's gardening zones shifted. This map shows you what's changed in vivid detail

description: He is expected to bolster the prosecutors case that Trump falsified business records to pay off Stormy Daniels, the adult film star, with whom he is alleged to have had an affair
title: Michael Cohen, Trump's former fixer, will testify against him in the hush-money trial

description: Almost half of the illicit fentanyl seized by law enforcement last year was pills made to look like prescription opioids, a new study says. The trend suggests a growing supply of illicit fentanyl.
title: Counterfeit fentanyl pills are becoming a lot more common in law enforcement seizures

description: Joy Diaz and her parents were dedicated to helping others. Then, they received some life-changing help themselves.
title: 'Here's the money. Buy a house': A kind family receives kindness in return

description: Childhood myopia, or nearsightedness, is growing rapidly in the U.S and around the world. Researchers say kids who spend two hours outside every day, are less likely to develop the condition.
title: Outdoor time is good for your kids' eyesight. Here's why

description: Here's what's to come in Donald Trump's legal battles, from Trump's Trials: Former Trump fixer Michael Cohen is expected to take the stand in the New York hush money trial this week.
title: Prosecutors need Michael Cohen to tie details together in Trump's hush money trial

description: Prosecutors are asking a judge to impose a 40-year prison sentence for the man who broke into ex-U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's home seeking to hold her hostage and attacked her husband.
title: Federal prosecutors request 40-year sentence for man who attacked Pelosi's husband

description: Catalonia's separatist parties are in danger of losing their hold on power in the northeastern region after the pro-union Socialist Party scored a historic result in Sunday's election.
title: Catalan separatists lose majority as Spain's Socialists win regional elections

description: Richard Slayman died almost two months after the historic procedure, the Boston hospital where he had the transplant said Saturday. At 62, he had the transplant to treat his end-stage kidney disease.
title: The first person to receive a genetically modified pig kidney transplant has died
